newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Brent quoted widely around London close.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Brent quoted widely around London close.

text.p: June Brent crude futures in Asia were untraded around midday on Friday, quoted around the London close with technical trading set to lead the market.
June was quoted on SIMEX at $18.18/$18.35 per barrel, after London shed 23 cents to settle at $18.29, near the intraday low of $18.26.
June Brent is expected to be capped for the time being at $18.77, the top of a previous chart gap reaching from $18.64.
The gap was almost closed in London trading on Wednesday, when June traded as high as $18.75. But its failure to cover the final two cents signalled a lack of upside momentum, analysts said.
Support for June was cited at $18.30.
NYMEX was offering little direction on ACCESS during the Asian day.
June was last traded at $19.92, up just one cent from New York, which fell 30 cents.
ACCESS had traded a range of just $19.96/$19.90 per barrel, on moderate volume of 380 lots, so far in the Asian day.
